title: Pluralistic: It all started with a mouse (15 Dec 2023)
description: Today's links It all started with a mouse: A masterclass on the public domain, fair use and trademark. Hey look at this: Delights to delectate. This day in history: 2003, 2008, 2013, 2018, 2022 Colophon: Recent publications, upcoming/recent appearances, current writing projects, current reading It all started with a mouse (permalink) For the public domain, time stopped in 1998, when the Sonny Bono Copyright Act froze copyright expirations for 20 years. In 2019, time started again, with a massive crop of works from 1923 returning to the public domain, free for all to use and adapt: https://web.law.duke.edu/cspd/publicdomainday/2019/ No one is better at conveying the power of the public domain than Jennifer Jenkins and James Boyle, who run the Duke Center for the Study of the Public Domain.
